noteGrp.note: Work ascribed to IA on the life and qualities of the Prophet, including the palm-tree miracle in Seville. The text has been analysed by Pablo Beneito (JMIAS 30, 2001).

OY cites no surviving mss., but we have inspected an early mss. in Jerusalem (Khalidiyya 967, 701H, of which there is a microfilm copy in the Dār al-kutub, Cairo.) which carries a dedication to IA’s sons and his daughter Fāṭima. This makes it highly likely that it is an authentic work. The work is mentioned in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269) and internal evidence as presented by Pablo Beneito (see JMIAS 30, 2001) supports the verification. There is some confusion between this work and K. al-Shamāʾil al-nabī, for which OY lists three mss and assigned a separate RG number (669). But our research so far indicates that there is only one work with variant titles. We have therefore consolidated under RG 276 and categorised RG 669 as a duplicate.
